titles: An elegy on the [right honourable] Anthony Earl of Shaftsbury, Who dyed on the 21st. of January, 1683.
notes: Includes: [An] elegy [on the death of (the] much to be lamented) Anthony K. of Poland.; [a Tory satire on Anthony Ashley Cooper, Earl of Shafte]sbury.
First verse - "The busie statemen who by toyle unblest,"; second verse - "THe busie Toney, who by Toil unblest".; the first poem matches Wing E434A.
Identified as Wing (2nd ed.) E436 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 2124.3.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Shaftesbury, Anthony Ashley Cooper, --  Earl of, 1621-1683 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
